sectr: Health and other social services,Public Administration, Law, and Justice,Education
trustfund: TF029219-PHRD-NORTHERN HEALTH & EDUC.(RECIPIENT-EXEC.),TF029221-PHRD -NORTHERN HEALTH & EDUC.(BANK-EXECUTED),TF032047-PAKISTAN - EDUCATION

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey satisfactory
            outcomes, likely sustainability, substantial institutional
            development impacts, accompanied by satisfactory
            performances by both the Bank and Borrower. While a wider
            range of issues were addressed under the project, the skill
            and personnel capacity limitations of the Directorates,
            particularly in northern areas, appears to have yielded the
            more modest gains found in the areas of decentralized
            monitoring, and support to schools, as well as in
            improvements in learning achievement, as a function of
            inputs for improved in-service training of teachers and
            curriculum/textbook reform. There is also the need for more
            accurate assessment of financial, and time requirement;  for
            more accurate assessment of institutional capacities; for
            adequate back-up provisions when inputs are contingent on
            each other; and, for recognition of collective reinforcement
            of community development. Lessons on implementation suggest
            improved teacher training; engaging communities to support
            schools in underserved areas; and, foster gradual phasing of
            new educational concepts.
